div.p: A VVOMAN forbidden to ſpeak in the CHURCH, The grounds examined, the Myſtery opened, the Truth cleared, and the ignorance both of Prieſts and People diſcovered.
Written by a friend of the Truth, whoſe Name in the fleſh is RICHARD FARNWORTH.

q.p: And Jeſus anſwering, ſaid unto them, Do ye not therefore err, becauſe ye know not the Scripture, neither the power of God,

For as many of you as have been baptized into Chriſt, have pur ou Chriſt: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female, for ye are all one in Chriſt Jeſus,
Jeſus anſwered and ſaid, My Doctrine is not mine, but his that ſent me; if any man will de his Will, he ſhall know of the Doctrine whether it be of God, or whether I ſpeak of my ſelf,

div.p: LONDON, Printed for Giles Calvert at the Black-Spread-Eagle, at the Weſt End of Pauls. 1655.

div.head: A Woman forbidden to ſpeak in the CHURCH.
The Grounds examined, the miſtery opened, the Truth cleared, the Ignorance both of Prieſts and People diſcovered.

q.p: But the Spirit of Truth may declare through the Temple, and dwell in it, which the World cannot receive,

div.p:
THe Church is in God the Father of our Lord Jeſus Chriſt, as Paul and Silvanus writ to the Theſſalonians, 1 Theſ. 1.1. and it is made all of living ſtones elect & pretions, 1 Pet. 2.5. and the Saints, their bodies are made fit Temples for the Holy Ghoſt to dwel in, 2 Cor. 6.16. and they are made a fit Habitation for God through the Spirit, being builded upon the Foundations of the Prophets, and the Apoſtles of the Lord Jeſus, in whom all the building fitly framed groweth unto an holy Temple in the Lord, Epheſ. 2.20, 21, 22. and in this Church are all taught of God, as it is written in the Prophets, Iſa. 54 13, 14. & Jer. 31.33, 34 and likewiſe in Heb. 8.10, 11. and ſaith Jeſus Chriſt in John 14. I will pray the Father, & he ſhall give you another Comforter, that he way abide with you for ever, even the Spirit of Truth, whom the world cannot receive, becauſe it ſeeth him not, neither knoweth him, but ye know him, for be dwelleth with you, & ſhall be in you, v. 16, 17. now nothing is to ſpeak in this Church which is ſpiritual, but that which is ſpiritual, even
the Holy Ghoſt, which is inviſible and incomprehenſible; the Woman or wiſdom of the Fleſh is forbidden to ſpeak in the Church, that is, of the things of God, for that which is fleſh is fleſh, and the natural man knows not the things of God, they are fooliſhneſs to him, neither can he know them, becauſe they are ſpiritually diſcerned, 1 Cor. 2.4. and ſo the carnal minded man he ſaith, that a Woman (or the female kind) ought not to ſpeak in the Church: now the firſt birth either in man or woman, hath nothing to do to ſpeak in the Church, (the carnal part) for it knows not the things of God, and every man by nature is a child of wrath, and he is forbidden to ſpeak with his carnal wiſdom, which he gathered out of Books and Studies, for that nature is adulterated from God, and nothing muſt ſpeak in the Church in God, but the Holy Ghoſt, and that may ſpeak in the Temple, either in male or female, nothing muſt ſpeak in the Church but the Spirit of Truth, whom the world and carnal minded ones know not, God is a Spirit, and they that know him, know him to be ſo, and none know him but they that are ſpiritual, for ſaith Jeſus Chriſt, Except ye be born again ye cannot enter into the Kingdom of Heaven, John 3, and that which is fleſh is fleſh, and that knoweth not the things of God neither in male nor female, but is adulterated from God, but that which is Spirit is Spirit, and is born of God either in male or female, that knoweth him, and that is permitted to ſpeak in the Temple, and none can call Jeſus Lord but the Holy Ghoſt, 1 Cor. 12.3. and the manifeſtation of the Spirit is given to profit withal, Ver. 7. and the Spirit of the Lord was made manifeſt through the Female kind, as Women in former Ages, and it was profitable; for Deborah ſhe had the manifeſtation of the Spirit of God ruling in her, by which ſhe, or the Lord in her, did adminiſter Juſtice to the Iſraelites, which were the Church, and People of God, and ſhe was a Judge amongſt them, and judged Iſrael, Iudges 4 4. and ſhe Propheſied to Barak; that at the River Kiſhon the Lord would deliver Siſera the Captain of Iabins Army into his hand; See the noble acts that the Lord did by the Prophet • ſs his Servant Debora, read Iudges 4.5. Chapters, and the Lord hath ſaid, he will pour out his Spirit upon all Fleſh, and their Sons and Daughters ſhall Propheſie, Ioel 2 28. he doth not ſay, that Fleſh ſhall propheſie neither in Sons nor Daughters, that is forbidden; Let all Fleſh be ſilent both in Sons and Daughters, and let the Spirit ſpeak, for that is permitted
either in Son or Daughter: it is the Spirit that Propheſies, and foretels of the things of God, and the manifeſtation of the Spirit is given to profit withall in a Daughter as well as in a Son, that God may ſpeak where he doth dwel in his Temple. Let all carnal Wiſdom in Male as well as in Female keep ſilence, for that is not permitted to ſpeak, it is adulterated from God, and the natural man knows not the things of God, and he that is joyned to an Harlot is one body, 1 Cor. 6.16. and that muſt be judged and caſt out by the Spirit of Truth, and judgement being brought forth into Victory, let the Truth declare it ſelf, but let all Fleſh be ſilent till the Spirit be poured out either in Son or Daughter, for all the Wiſdom of the World it knoweth not God, who is a Spirit, and he chuſeth the weak things of this world to confound the things which are mighty, 1 Cor. 1.27:28:29. and the Woman is counted the weaker Veſſel, but the Lord filling that Veſſel full of his Wiſdom, and ruling it by his holy Spirit, he dwelling in his Temple, and declaring himſelf through it by his Son Ieſus Chriſt, it is for the praiſe of the glory of his Grace, that no Fleſh might glory in his ſight, for that muſt be trodden under foot, fleſhly Wiſdom, and carnal Reaſon both in Male and Female, that the Lord may be all in all in the Creature, making them fit Temples for his holy Spirit to dwel in, 1 Cor. 3.16. That he may ſpeak in his Temple, in the Female as well as the Male.

The Body it is but the Temple, it is the Man-child Chriſt Ieſus, where he is bornup into the underſtanding that is to declare the Fathers will, and that is permitted to ſpeak, the Spirit of Truth which the world cannot receive, Ioh. 14 16:17, 26. but not carnal Wiſdom, and fleſhly imaginations, which is out of Covenant with God, and muſt be burnt up by the Spirit of Truth, before the Temple be fitted and prepared for the Maſters uſe, for nothing muſt ſpeak in the Church but the Spirit of the Living God, let all Fleſh keep Silence, that is not permitted to ſpeak in any, and Paul he was made a Miniſter, not by the will of Man, but by the will of God, Who revealed his Son in him, Gal. 1 8, and your Daughters ſhall propheſie, Acts 2.17, 18. And there was one man which had four Daughters which were Virgins, and they did Propheſie, Acts 21.8:9. and he ſaith, all may Propheſie one by one, that all may learn, and all may be comforted, and the Spirits of the Prophets are ſubject to the Prophets, 1 Cor. 14.30:31. it is the Spirit that is to Propheſie, and 'tis the Spirit that is to
ſpeak in the Church, and where the Spirit is made manifeſt it is profitable to others, & none can call Ieſus Lord, but by the Holy Ghoſt, and where he ſaith, Let your Women keep ſilence in the Church &c. for he ſaith, it is a ſhame for Women to ſpeak in the Church, but he doth not ſay, let the Spirit of God keep ſilence in the Temple, but that may declare where it is manifeſted, either in Male or Female, and then it is the Man Chriſt that ſpeaks in them, for great is the Myſtery of Godlineſs, Chriſt in you the hope of glory, Col. 1.27. and his ſheep they hear his Voice: If any man hath an ear to hear let him hear what the Spirit ſaith; for ſaith the Lord by the Holy Ghoſt, Let no men deceive you, for if any man among you, ſeem to be wiſe in this World, let him become a fool that he may be made wiſe, for the Wiſdom of this world is fooliſhneſs with God, for it is written, he taketh the wiſe in their own craftineſs, and the Lord knoweth the thoughts of the Wiſe that they are vain, 1 Cor. 3.18, 19, 20. man by his carnal wiſdom is ſottiſh in the things of God, that he would compare ſpiritual things with carnal things, becauſe his wiſdom and underſtanding is altogether carnal, to be carnally minded is death, Rom. 8.6. but the Holy Ghoſt teacheth to compare ſpiritual things with ſpiritual things, becauſe they are ſpiritually diſcerned, and the natural man knows them not, for they are fooliſhneſs unto him, 1 Cor. 2.11:12:13:14.

Now the Scriptures were not ſpoke forth by the will of man, nor by the carnal mind, and fallen wiſdom, if they had the carnal mind could have underſtood them, but as they was ſpoken forth by the Holy Ghoſt, which the carnal mind or faln wiſdom knows not; therefore the Scriptures are a Myſtery to the firſt nature in man, and he reads, but doth not underſtand, for the life of them is hid from his carnal mind, and ſo he argues from them carnally, but he can deceive none now but blind men, and Fools like himſelf, for a wiſe mans Eyes are in his Head, his Light is in Chriſt, and he ſeeth that the Scriptures need not an Orthodox Key, for Holy men of God as they were moved they ſpoke them forth by the Holy Ghoſt, 2 Pet. 1.19:20:21. and where that is made manifeſt again it reads them plainly, but till then they read they know not what, as the worldly Wiſe men, and Sir Simons do now, that gets pearking up into a high place, ſuch as the Phariſees uſed, who were Enemies to Jeſus Chriſt then, as they are now, and they are called of men Maſters as they were, and without money will they do nothing: but now the Key of David
is found again, and it is turn'd about freely to unfold the Myſtery that hath been hid, amd revealeth the Myſtery both to Sons and Daughters, according to the promiſe of the Lord, ſo that the Woman Jezabel, that hath ſo long born Rule in the Synagouge of Sathan, where Simon Magus did rule, that ſold the Letter for money, will not now be permitted to ſpeak in the Church, but caſt out, for the wiſdom of the Fleſh muſt not be ſuffered to uſurp authority over the Man-child, the Spirit of Truth, for he will rule, and all DEVINERS will be MAD, Iſa. 44.24, 25. ſuch as ye proud Prieſts are, that ſell the Letter without the Spirit, and ſpeak Divinations of their own Brains, and not from the mouth of the Lord, and ſuch muſt now be ſtopped, and not permitted to ſpeak in the Church, nor of the things of God, by their carnal wiſdom, which is fooliſhneſs with God, and their ſtudied out Knowledge which is adulterated from God, and leads them a whoring after their own inventions, forſaking the Fountain of living mercies to delight in lying vanities, but now they muſt come under the Law, and be ſeverely puniſhed, and their mouths will be ſtopped by the Truth, for it is written, Thou ſhalt not muzzle the mouth of the Ox that treadeth out the Corn; and I will have mercy and not ſacrifice: go to the School of Chriſt to learn what that meaneth, and then you will know what the Apoſtle ſaith in that place of Scripture; when you are come through the fire, to have your own works, and Wiſdom, and ſtudied out Arts burned, 1 Cor. 2.13:14:15:16. that you may know the ſame mind ruling in the Temple that was in Chriſt, that nothing may be done through ſtrife or vain-glory, but in lowlineſs of mind, each one eſteeming other better than themſelves, and being of one accord, and one mind, as they were that ſpoke forth the Scriptures, Phil. 8.1:2:3:4:5:6: to the 12. Then will you know what is to be underſtood concerning the Womans non-permiſſion, but read on in that place of 1 Cor. 14. and ſee the following Verſes, where he hath been ſpeaking of the Woman, and he ſaith in the 36. Verſe, What, ſaith he, came the Word of God out from you, or came it unto you onely? for ſaith he, If any man think himſelf to be a Prophet or ſpiritual, let him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the commands of the Lord; but if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant, 1 Cor. 14.36:37:38. but he doth exhort to propheſie, and ſaith, forbid it not, but rather covet after it, and your Daughters they ſhall propheſie as well as Sons, and the Spirits
manifeſtation is to profit with all; therefore forbid not to ſpeak with Tongues, the Tongue of the learned, ſuch as are taught of God, by the Spirit of Truth, the Holy Ghoſt, which the world cannot receive, and that is to ſpeak in the Temple, and in the Church, for elſe Paul would not have commended Phebe to have been a Miniſter, or Servant to the Church, Rom. 16.1. if he had forbidden the Spirit of Truth for being declared through Women in the Church: but are ye not yet carnal, and it is carnality which is forbidden to intermingle with ſpirituality; for Paul writ to the Romans to receive Phebe, which was a Servant or Miniſter to the Church at Cenerea, and not onely to receive her, but to receive her in the Lord, and to aſſiſt her in whatſoever buſineſs ſhe had need of, Rom. 16.3. and he writ to them alſo to greet Priſcilla, and Aquila; and ſee what he ſaith more in 3:4:5. Verſes, and ſaith he, Greet Mary, who beſtowed much labour on us, Rom, 16.6. and ſaith he, Salute Tryphena, Tpythena and Tryphoſa delicious or delicate, two godly Women, beloved of the Lord who laboured with P …
in the Go ſpel, and Perſis a faithful woman, who laboured much in the Lord with Paul in the Goſpel, Rom. 6.1. and Tryphoſa, who labour in the Lord, and ſalute Rufus choſen in the Lord, and his Mother, and mine; and many are called but few choſen, as theſe, Rom. 16.13. Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereas and his Siſter, and Olympas, and all the Saints that are with them, Salute one another with an holy kiſs, the Churches of Chriſt ſalute you, Rom. 16.15:16.

And Again ſaith Paul to the Brethren, Help thoſe Women that laboured with me in the Goſpel, with Clement alſo, and with other my fellow labourers, whoſe Names are in the Book of life, Phil. 4.1:2:3. Here is not Women forbidden to ſpeak in the Church where the Spirit of Chriſt was manifeſt to rule, but they are ſaluted with an holy kiſs in the Lord, and Woman-labourers in the Goſpel, and they are to be received in the Lord, and to be aſſiſted, &c. But ſaith he, Mark them which cauſe diviſions, and offences contrary to the Doctrine of Chriſt, which ye have learned, and avoid them, for they that are ſuch ſerve not our Lord Jeſus Chriſt, but their own bellies, as the Prieſts of the World do now in this generation, who by good words and fair ſpeeches deceive the hearts of the ſimple, Rom. 16 17, 18. Now ſuch as theſe that ſerve themſelves, and their bellies, and ſeeks for great Benefits, and teach for Tithes, Bribes, Augmentations, Gifts and Rewards, as the Prieſts do, contrary to the practice of the Saints, and ſpeaks by their own wiſdom, and not from the mouth of the Lord, they cauſe diviſions and diſſentions, and they are to be marked, and to be caſt out, and not to ſpeak in the Church, nor of
ſpiritual things, by their carnal reaſon, therefore take counſel, and hold them not up, the Lord is againſt them.

But to Aquila and Priſcilla ſalute me, and to the Church that is in their Houſe, 1 Cor. 16.19 and let her ſpeak by the Spirit of the Lord the things of God made manifeſt unto her, for if ſhe be not permitted to ſpeak in the Church, and the Church be in her houſe, ſhe muſt not ſpeak, but go out of her houſe; but the Spirit of Truth is permitted to ſpeak in any, where it is made manifeſt, the manifeſtation of the Spirit being given to profit withal, 1 Cor. 12 and every good gift, and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableneſs, neither ſhadow of turning, for of his own will begat he us with the word of Truth, that we ſhould be a kind of firſt fruits of his creatures, Jam. 1.17:18, that we may be to the praiſe of the glory of his grace, who calleth us out of darkneſs into his marvellous light, and maketh us ſit together with Chriſt Jeſus in heavenly places, Eph. 2.4:5:6. To him alone be praiſe, honor and glory, who is King of Kings, and Lord of Lords; therefore let God ariſe, and let his Enemies be ſcattered abroad, for he will make his People a willing People now in the day of his power, to worſhip him in Spirit, and to ſerve him both day, and eke each hour. Amen.
Hallelujah to the Higheſt, the Lord God omnipotent reigneth. Let all that love the Lord, bleſs the Lord, praiſe him, and magnifie him for ever.
